[blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [ShortcutRegistry](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.md)

## ShortcutRegistry class

Class for the registry of keyboard shortcuts. This is intended to be a singleton. You should not create a new instance, and only access this class from ShortcutRegistry.registry.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class ShortcutRegistry 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [registry](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.registry_property.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | [ShortcutRegistry](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.md) |  |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [addKeyMapping(keyCode, shortcutName, allowCollision)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.addkeymapping_1_method.md) |  | <p>Adds a mapping between a keycode and a keyboard shortcut.</p><p>Normally only one shortcut can be mapped to any given keycode, but setting allowCollisions to true allows a keyboard to be mapped to multiple shortcuts. In that case, when onKeyDown is called with the given keystroke, it will process the mapped shortcuts in reverse order, from the most- to least-recently mapped).</p> |
|  [createSerializedKey(keyCode, modifiers)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.createserializedkey_1_method.md) |  | Creates the serialized key code that will be used in the key map. |
|  [getKeyCodesByShortcutName(shortcutName)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.getkeycodesbyshortcutname_1_method.md) |  | Gets the serialized key codes that the shortcut with the given name is registered under. |
|  [getKeyMap()](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.getkeymap_1_method.md) |  | Gets the current key map. |
|  [getRegistry()](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.getregistry_1_method.md) |  | Gets the registry of keyboard shortcuts. |
|  [getShortcutNamesByKeyCode(keyCode)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.getshortcutnamesbykeycode_1_method.md) |  | Gets the shortcuts registered to the given key code. |
|  [onKeyDown(workspace, e)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.onkeydown_1_method.md) |  | <p>Handles key down events.</p><p>- Any <code>KeyboardShortcut</code>(s) mapped to the keycodes that cause event <code>e</code> to be fired will be processed, in order from least- to most-recently registered. - If the shortcut's <code>preconditionFn</code> exists it will be called. If <code>preconditionFn</code> returns false the shortcut's <code>callback</code> function will be skipped. Processing will continue with the next shortcut, if any. - The shortcut's <code>callback</code> function will then be called. If it returns true, processing will terminate and <code>onKeyDown</code> will return true. If it returns false, processing will continue with with the next shortcut, if any. - If all registered shortcuts for the given keycode have been processed without any having returned true, <code>onKeyDown</code> will return false.</p> |
|  [register(shortcut, allowOverrides)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.register_1_method.md) |  | Registers a keyboard shortcut. |
|  [removeAllKeyMappings(shortcutName)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.removeallkeymappings_1_method.md) |  | Removes all the key mappings for a shortcut with the given name. Useful when changing the default key mappings and the key codes registered to the shortcut are unknown. |
|  [removeKeyMapping(keyCode, shortcutName, quiet)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.removekeymapping_1_method.md) |  | Removes a mapping between a keycode and a keyboard shortcut. |
|  [reset()](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.reset_1_method.md) |  | Clear and recreate the registry and keyMap. |
|  [setKeyMap(newKeyMap)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.setkeymap_1_method.md) |  | Sets the key map. Setting the key map will override any default key mappings. |
|  [unregister(shortcutName)](./blockly.shortcutregistry_class.unregister_1_method.md) |  | Unregisters a keyboard shortcut registered with the given name. This will also remove any key mappings that reference this shortcut. |
